statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 0 \\ 3 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 7 \\ 2 \\ 8 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -12 \\ 5 \\ 6 \\ -24 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 0 \\ 3 \\ -5 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 7 \\ 2 \\ 8 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -12 \\ 5 \\ 6 \\ -24 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
